result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Joy Patten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Correspondence between clerk, Atty Hendee & Atty Gumz re: joint & several restitution
to Appear
Associated with Charge #1
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
Victim Impact Statement

Defendant Lisa Joy Patten in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Lisa Joy Patten in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.    State has complied with victim notification requirements and files a victim impact statement with the court.  
Court reviewed the victim impact statement.  Atty Gumz agrees with the agreement.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz states that there should be some credit.  Court questions Atty Hendee.  Atty Hendee asks that the court allow the credit to be determined through a stipulation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions; consecutive to any sentence the defendant is currently serving
Court Costs = $243.00
Restitution = $50,941.78 + $5,094.17 surcharge = $56,035.95 (as stated in the supplement and paid out as in the disposition)
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
No contact with co-defendant Colton Hancock
No DNA required

*Credit to be determined by stipulation between counsel which is only available if revoked.

*Per agreement: restitution is joint and several with co-defendant, Colton Hancock

Return date at 01-20-2016 01:30 pm

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has charges in other States and Counties; he will leave further update with Atty Gumz.
Atty Gumz responds and states that he was trying to get a consolidation with Langlade County but he has not heard anything on that yet.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant is on a significant amount of cash bond from Oconto County.  Atty Gumz asks that this be set in January.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
